docs.snippet: The Officers of the Sixty-ninth Regiment now in New-York assembled Wednesday evening at the Metropolitan Hotel to testify their gratification at the return of Lieut. EDMOND CONNOLLY from imprisonment in the South, that gentleman having been captured...

headline.main: The Sixty-ninth Regiment.; TESTIMONIAL TO LIEUT, CONNOLLY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Officers of the Sixty-ninth Regiment now in New-York assembled Wednesday evening at the Metropolitan Hotel to testify their gratification at the return of Lieut. EDMOND CONNOLLY from imprisonment in the South, that gentleman having been captured at the battle of Manassas, and held until lately by the rebel authorities.

docs.snippet: From Havana papers received yesterday by the steamship Columbia, we derive the following interesting and important intelligence:

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM MEXICO.; Miramon a Prisoner on Board the English Frigate Challenger. Return of the Commissioners to Vera Cruz with a Mexican Plenipotentiary, JUAREZ DISPOSED TO NEGOTIATE. Another Movenment of the Allied Forces into the Interior. Troops Ordered from Tejeria to Medellin.

docs.abstract: Gen. Miramon held prisoner aboard British frigate Challenger; allied forces moving into interior

docs.snippet: In the Senate, yesterday, favorable reports were made on the bills proving for the examination of the accounts of the Canal Department and the State Treasurer, and to amend the Revised Stateutes relative to lawkers and peddlers.

headline.main: OUR HAVANA CORRESPONDENCE.; Rumored Relirement of Gen. Serrano-A Great Ball in Prospect Arrival of Prince Affred Miramon taken from an English Steamer Financial Matters The Diario and the Times.

docs.snippet: The United States store-ship Supply, Capt. COLVO CORESSIS commanding, from Ship Island, on Jan. 24th, arrived at this port yesterday.

headline.main: NEWS FROM SHIP ISLAND.; Arrival of the U.S. Storeship Supply, with an English Sehooner as a Prize, and a Valuable Prize Cargo Favorable Condition of Affairs at Ship Island.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States store-ship Supply, Capt. COLVO CORESSIS commanding, from Ship Island, on Jan. 24th, arrived at this port yesterday.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON; Debate on the Treasury Note Bill in the Senate. Amendments of the Finance Committee Concurred in.Another Herald Correspondentin Trouble.Arrest and Imprisonment of the ChevalierWikoff for Contempt of the House. THE GOOD NEWS. COAST COMMUNICATIONS. CHEVALIER WIKOFF IN JAIL. ANOTHER CORRESPONDENT IN DANGER. INGS. GEN. SMITH NOT WITHDRAWN. POSTAGE ON PRINTED MATTER. docs.abstract: NY Herald correspondent C Wikoff jailed for contempt of US House in refusing to give source of classified White House information; Correspondent C Wikoff jailed, Washington, for contempt of House of Representatives for refusing to tell where he received classified White House information

docs.snippet: A flag of truce was sent to Craney Island early this morning, to inform Gen. HUGER that the prisoners of war from Fort Warren arrived in the bark Trinity last night.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT FORTRESS MONROE.; Arrival of the Released Prisoners News from the South The Position at Savannah The Rebel Authorities Stopping the Manufacture of Whisky.

docs.lead_paragraph: A flag of truce was sent to Craney Island early this morning, to inform Gen. HUGER that the prisoners of war from Fort Warren arrived in the bark Trinity last night.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF MESSRS. MASON AND SLIDELL IN ENGLAND.

docs.lead_paragraph: The liberated Confederate Commissioners to England and France, Messrs. MASON and SLIDELL, accompanied by their Secretaries, Messrs. McFARLAND and EUSTIS, arrived here this morning on board the Royal Mail Company's steamship La Plata, Capt. C. G. WELLER. A more literal restoration of the status ...
